wikipedia_page.main: Robert 'Bob' C Addy (born 24 January 1941) is a former British cyclist. He competed in the team time trial at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He also represented England in the road race at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Perth, Western Australia.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1964 Summer Olympics

response: In a 1900 book, Cap Anson described Addy's playing style, writing, "Bob Addy, who was one of the best of the lot, was a good, hard hustling player, a good base runner and a hard hitter. He was as honest as the day is long... He was an odd sort of a genius and quit the game because he thought he could do better at something else."
| 1963 || Bob Addy || John Clarey || Billy Perkins
